title: A High-Fidelity Speech Super Resolution Network using a Complex Global Attention Module with Spectro-Temporal Loss
author: Tarikul Islam Tamiti (George Mason University), Biraj Joshi (George Mason University), Rida Hasan (George Mason University), Rashedul Hasan (Chittagong University of Engineering & Technology), Taieba Athay (Chittagong University of Engineering & Technology), Nursad Mamun (Chittagong University of Engineering & Technology), Anomadarshi Barua (George Mason University), ...
relevance_why: This paper addresses speech super-resolution, a key area in audio quality enhancement, which directly aligns with my focus on audio processing and speech enhancement.
background: Speech super-resolution is the task of reconstructing high-frequency components from low-resolution speech signals to improve perceptual quality.
contribution: This paper introduces the Complex Time-Frequency Transformation Network (CTFT-Net) to solve the complex challenges of phase and magnitude reconstruction in speech super-resolution, achieving significant improvements in audio quality metrics.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focused on either spectral or time-domain features, often neglecting important phase information, which could lead to degraded audio quality.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon existing techniques by integrating complex-valued processing and dual-path attention mechanisms to jointly model both phase and frequency information.

key_innovation: CTFT-Net's ability to handle amplitude and phase reconstruction in complex domains represents a significant advancement in speech super-resolution methodologies.
real_world_impact: This research has the potential to enhance various applications like telecommunication, voice recognition systems, and assistive technologies, improving the clarity and naturalness of synthesized speech.

new_terms.Complex Time-Frequency Transformation Ne: CTFT-Net is a neural network architecture designed to perform speech super-resolution in the complex domain, effectively reconstructing frequency and phase components.
new_terms.Complex Global Attention Block (CGAB): CGAB is a novel attention mechanism that captures dependencies across both time and frequency dimensions in a complex-valued spectrogram.

open_sourcing: Source code of the model will be available after acceptance.
